flawed_nl_solution:
Each hour Jimmy makes 60min / 10min/pizza = <<60/10=6>>6 Pizzas
The number of total pizzas made equals 7 hours x 6 pizzas/hour = <<7*6=24>>24 pizzas
The amount of total flour used equals 24 pizzas x 0.5 kg/pizza = <<24*0.5=12>>12 kg
The amount of flour left equals 22 kg - 12 kg = <<22-12=10>>10 kg
The number of pizzas Jimmy can make is 10kg / 0.5kg/pizza = <<10/0.5=20>>20 pizzas

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 42.0, not 24.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
